teal.osprey 0.1.0

  • Changelog

Spiderplot Teal Module

tm_g_spiderplot.Rd

Display spiderplot as a shiny module

tm_g_spiderplot(label, dataname, paramcd, paramcd_choices = paramcd,
  x_var, x_var_choices = x_var, y_var, y_var_choices = y_var,
  marker_var, marker_var_choices = marker_var, line_colorby_var,
  line_colorby_var_choices = line_colorby_var_choices,
  vref_line = NULL, href_line = NULL, anno_txt_var,
  legend_on = FALSE, xfacet_var = NULL,
  xfacet_var_choices = xfacet_var, yfacet_var = NULL,
  yfacet_var_choices = y_facet_var, plot_height, pre_output = NULL,
  post_output = NULL, code_data_processing = NULL)

Arguments

label

menu item label of the module in the teal app
dataname

analysis data used in teal module, needs to be available in the list passed to the data argument of init. Note that the data is expected to be in vertical form with the PARAMCD variable filtering to one observation per patient.
paramcd

single selected endpoint filtered with PARAMCD variable
paramcd_choices

vector with paramcd choices
x_var

x-axis variables
x_var_choices

vector with x_var choices
y_var

y-axis variables
y_var_choices

vector with y_var choices
marker_var

variable dictates marker symbol
marker_var_choices

vector with marker_var choices
line_colorby_var

variable dictates line color
line_colorby_var_choices

vector with line_colorby_var choices
vref_line

vertical reference lines
href_line

horizontal reference lines
anno_txt_var

annotation text
legend_on

boolean value for whether legend is displayed
xfacet_var

variable for x facets
xfacet_var_choices

vector with xfacet_var choices
yfacet_var

variable for y facets
yfacet_var_choices

vector with yfacet_var choices
plot_height

range of plot height
pre_output

optional, shiny.tag with text placed before the output to put the output into context. For example the helpText elements are useful.
post_output

optional, shiny.tag with text placed before the output to put the output into context. For example the helpText elements are useful.
code_data_processing

string with data preprocessing before the teal app is initialized, default is NULL

Value

an module object

Examples



# NOT RUN {
#Example spiderplot
library(dplyr)

data("rADSL")
data("rADTR")

ASL <- rADSL
ATR <- rADTR
#dat <- left_join(ATR, ASL) %>% filter(PARAMCD == "SUMTGLES") %>% as.data.frame()

# test character vector as x axis labels
#ATR$TUDY <- as.character(ATR$TUDY)

x <- teal::init(
  data = list(ASL = ASL, ATR = ATR),
  modules = root_modules(
    tm_g_spiderplot(
       label = "Spiderplot",
       dataname = "ATR",
       paramcd = "SLDINV",
       paramcd_choices = "SLDINV",
       x_var = "ADY",
       x_var_choices = "ADY",
       y_var = "PCHG",
       y_var_choices = c("PCHG", "CHG", "AVAL"),
       marker_var = "SEX",
       marker_var_choices = c("SEX", "RACE", "USUBJID"),
       line_colorby_var = "SEX",
       line_colorby_var_choices = c("SEX","USUBJID", "RACE"),
       vref_line = "10, 37",
       href_line = "-20, 0",
       anno_txt_var = TRUE,
       legend_on = FALSE,
       xfacet_var = "SEX",
       xfacet_var_choices = c("SEX", "ARM"),
       yfacet_var = "ARM",
       yfacet_var_choices = c("ARM", "SEX"),
       plot_height = c(600, 200, 2000)
   )
  )
)

shinyApp(x$ui, x$server)
# }
